[Captain](/wiki/Captain_\(United_States_O-6\) "Captain \(United States O-6\)")
**Bud J. Roberts Jr.** ,
[JAGC](/wiki/Judge_Advocate_General%27s_Corps,_U.S._Navy "Judge Advocate
General's Corps, U.S. Navy"), [USN](/wiki/United_States_Navy "United States
Navy") is a fictional character in the _[JAG](/wiki/JAG_\(TV_series\) "JAG
\(TV series\)")_ TV series played by [Patrick
Labyorteaux](/wiki/Patrick_Labyorteaux "Patrick Labyorteaux").

The character has also appeared twice on _[NCIS](/wiki/NCIS_\(TV_series\)
"NCIS \(TV series\)")_

## Character arc[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Bud_Roberts&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Character arc")]

Son of a retired [Master Chief](/wiki/Master_chief_petty_officer "Master chief
petty officer"), Roberts joined the [Navy](/wiki/United_States_Navy "United
States Navy"), and as an [Ensign](/wiki/Ensign_\(rank\) "Ensign \(rank\)") was
assigned to sea duty aboard the USS _Seahawk_ as the Public Affairs officer
under Captain Ross. It was during this role as the PAO aboard the _Seahawk_ ,
that he first met Lt. [Harmon Rabb](/wiki/Harmon_Rabb "Harmon Rabb"), and his
partner Lt. (j.g.) [Caitlin Pike](/wiki/Caitlin_Pike "Caitlin Pike"), when
they arrived to investigate a murder; this got him interested in a career in
law, and it was later Lt. (j.g.) [Meg Austin](/wiki/Meg_Austin "Meg Austin")
who recommended him for transfer to JAG prior to her own transfer from JAG
staff. He attended [law school](/wiki/Law_school "Law school") in the evenings
at [George Mason University School of
Law](/wiki/George_Mason_University_School_of_Law "George Mason University
School of Law") and, upon scoring top grades in his finals, was assigned extra
legal responsibilities and acted as a trial counsel for special [courts-
martial](/wiki/Court-martial "Court-martial"). [Sarah
MacKenzie](/wiki/Sarah_MacKenzie "Sarah MacKenzie") and his wife [Harriet
Sims](/wiki/Harriet_Sims "Harriet Sims") are the only people Roberts will
allow to view his law school grades. He, his younger brother Mikey ([Michael
Bellisario](/wiki/Michael_Bellisario "Michael Bellisario")) and sister
Winifred (Winnie) had a somewhat strained relationship with their father, who
raised them himself after the death of their mother, due to his physical and
sometimes abusive methods of disciplining them. Bud's last meeting with LCDR
Rabb prior to his transfer to JAG Headquarters was in the first-season episode
"Skeleton Crew," when Rabb had been dispatched to investigate the murder of a
former Academy classmate (and a love interest).

Roberts is well liked and well respected by everyone at JAG headquarters, and
is often considered one of the better trial lawyers there. His success rate in
the courtroom is often contributed to by his opponents' underestimation of him
and his abilities. Harm had once said of him, "Watch out for his _' Aw,
shucks, I have a lot to learn'_ routine", alluding to Roberts' ability to
appear less intelligent than he actually was. After returning to JAG
headquarters following the loss of his right leg from a landmine, Bud was
assigned to working Disability cases; he proved his worth to JAG when he
investigated and successfully turned in a refusal of benefits when he noticed
a sailor damaging his eyes with self-inflicted laser burns. Shortly
thereafter, Bud returned to full limited duty in the court room.

Though not the physical type, Bud has been known to become so when the
situation demands it; he once caught a punch thrown by his father, and was
able to subdue the larger man without difficulty. The incident where his jaw
was broken when he stepped between two simultaneous punches from Rabb and the
Australian officer [Lt. Cmdr Mic
Brumby](/wiki/JAG_characters#Lieutenant_Commander_Michael_.22Mic.22_Brumby.2C_CSC.2C_RAN
"JAG characters") outside of an Australian courtroom had more to do with the
physical limitations of the human body than lack of physical prowess. At the
time of the taping, actor Patrick Labyorteaux had earlier suffered an accident
that had broken his jaw, causing it to be wired shut and producers opted to
write it into the storyline.

LtJG Roberts married Ensign [Harriet Sims](/wiki/Harriet_Sims "Harriet Sims")
in 1998.[1] Together, they had five children:

  * A.J. Roberts (named in the honor of RAdm [A.J. Chegwidden](/wiki/A.J._Chegwidden "A.J. Chegwidden"), however not taking his proper first and middle names _Albert Jethro._)
  * Sarah Roberts (named in the honor of Lt.Col [Sarah MacKenzie](/wiki/Sarah_MacKenzie "Sarah MacKenzie")). Unfortunately, the child died due to complications in childbirth.
  * James Kirk Roberts (named in the honor of Capt [James T. Kirk](/wiki/James_T._Kirk "James T. Kirk")). Bud was a big [Star Trek](/wiki/Star_Trek "Star Trek") fan.
  * Unnamed twins (a boy and a girl) born towards the end of the series (the girl is called Nikki in episode "Straits of Malacca").

Lieutenant Roberts was assigned as Judge Advocate on the USS _Seahawk_ during
the beginning of the [War on Terrorism](/wiki/War_on_Terrorism "War on
Terrorism") in 2002. He lost a leg trying to save a boy from a field of
[landmines](/wiki/Landmine "Landmine") in [Afghanistan](/wiki/Afghanistan
"Afghanistan") that year.[2] He was transferred back to JAG HQ after his
operation and proving that he was still able to meet the fitness requirements
of the U.S. Navy.

Roberts was promoted to the rank of [Lieutenant
Commander](/wiki/Lieutenant_Commander "Lieutenant Commander") in 2004 in "Hail
and Farewell" Part 1, which was the final act of command of the Judge Advocate
General, [Rear Admiral A.J. Chegwidden](/wiki/A.J._Chegwidden "A.J.
Chegwidden"), at his dining out. Bud had already been passed over for
promotion twice, meaning that if he were to be passed over a third time, he
would have been involuntarily separated from the Navy.

In the series' final episode, LCDR Roberts chose to remain at JAG HQ after
being offered billets by [Captain Rabb](/wiki/Harmon_Rabb "Harmon Rabb") and
[Lt.Col MacKenzie](/wiki/Sarah_MacKenzie "Sarah MacKenzie").

### On _NCIS_[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Bud_Roberts&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: On NCIS")]

Bud Roberts also appears in the first season of the _JAG_ spin-off
_[NCIS](/wiki/NCIS_\(TV_series\) "NCIS \(TV series\)")_ , during his tenure on
_JAG_ , where [Special Agent Gibbs](/wiki/Leroy_Jethro_Gibbs "Leroy Jethro
Gibbs") hopes Roberts will help "lawyer" him past a prohibition on the use of
the DNA profiles stored by the Department of Defense.[3]

He then reappears after an absence of more than eleven years in the fourteenth
season, having been promoted to Captain and still assigned to JAG
Headquarters, where he meets up with [Timothy McGee](/wiki/Timothy_McGee
"Timothy McGee") and assisted the NCIS MCRT in the investigation of the
homicide of a fellow JAG officer. McGee asks him about Harm and Mac, but
Roberts is interrupted by the arrival of NCIS Special Agent Alexandra Quinn
before he can reveal the results of the series' infamous final coin toss.[4]

Bud Roberts and AJ Chegwidden (played by [John M.
Jackson](/wiki/John_M._Jackson "John M. Jackson")) are thus far the only two
characters from the regular _JAG_ cast who have appeared in _NCIS_ as the same
character they played in the parent show.

## Nuclear
Football[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Bud_Roberts&action=edit&section=5 "Edit
section: Nuclear Football")]

In one episode, Lieutenant Roberts was selected to carry the [nuclear
football](/wiki/Nuclear_football "Nuclear football"). He had trepidations
about this duty, as he was worried that he would be responsible for the deaths
of many innocent people. While he was on duty as the Military Aide to the
White House, the President whose "nuclear football" he was guarding ([George
W. Bush](/wiki/George_W._Bush "George W. Bush")) attended a conference. During
this conference, Bud had to go to the bathroom. When he reemerges, the
President is gone. Bud then runs the three miles to the White House with the
40 pound nuclear football. This closely resembles a real event, when President
[Bill Clinton](/wiki/Bill_Clinton "Bill Clinton") once left a meeting in such
haste that he left behind his military aide, who then ran to the White House.
